title: BJP Leader Found Dead In Bengal, Party Blames Trinamool: Cops
desc: The death of a BJP booth-level leader in West Bengal's Purba Medinipur district kept the political cauldron on the boil in the state as the saffron camp alleged that he was murdered by the Trinamool Congress.

title: 231 Indians Leave Jeddah Onboard IAF Aircraft As Operation Kaveri Continues
desc: Under 'Operation Kaveri', the 12th flight carrying 231 stranded Indian evacuees, departed from Jeddah on a Mumbai-bound flight.

title: Bihar Cabinet Approves Proposal To Recruit 1.78 Lakh Teachers
desc: The Bihar Cabinet on Tuesday approved the proposal to recruit 1.78 lakh teachers for primary, middle, and upper classes in the state.

title: "They Are Stealing Democracy": Priyanka Gandhi's Jibe At BJP In Karnataka
desc: Taking a jibe at the Bharatiya Janta Party (BJP) Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Tuesday said that the saffron party is stealing democracy and urged the people to cast their votes in favour of the grand old party.

title: No Complaints, Lowest Cancellation Rate In First 3 Months, Claims Go First
desc: The cash-strapped domestic airline Go First Airlines had reported zero Passenger complaints and the lowest cancellation rate in the first three months of 2023.

title: "Anurag Thakur Tried To Suppress Matter": Vinesh Phogat Amid Protest
desc: India's ace wrestler Vinesh Phogat, who has been protesting at Jantar Mantar with other top grapplers against Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) chief and BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, has said it is tough to stand against a powerful person

title: Mumbai Cops Arrest 5 For Extorting Money While Posing As Policemen
desc: Mumbai Police on Tuesday arrested five persons including two from Kolkata and one from Hyderabad for allegedly extorting money online by posing as policemen.

title: Case Filed Against Cop And His Brother For Gang-Raping Woman In UP: Police
desc: A police constable and his brother were booked for allegedly gang-raping a woman on the pretext of marriage, police said on Tuesday.

title: Delhi Couple Arrested For Killing Man, Dumping Body In Drain: Police
desc: A man and his wife have been arrested for allegedly killing a person and later disposing of his body in a drain in southwest Delhi's Uttam Nagar area, police said on Tuesday.

title: "Congress Realises Its Nationwide Strength When It Comes To": Sharad Pawar
desc: The Congress suddenly remembers its stature as a national party when it is dealing with other parties and this attitude was evident during the formation of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) alliance, NCP leader Sharad Pawar has said.

title: 7-Year-Old Girl Attacked By Stray Dogs In Southwest Delhi, Say Cops
desc: A seven-year-old girl was allegedly bitten by stray dogs while she was playing outside her house in southwest Delhi's Rangpuri area, police said on Tuesday. The incident took place on April 27, they said.

title: Will Pay For Higher Education Of Girls: Shivraj Chouhan's Big Announcement
desc: The Shivraj Singh Chouhan government in Madhya Pradesh will pay the fees of girl students getting admission for higher education, including IITs, IIMs, medical and law colleges and other institutions.

title: Soldier Killed In Blast In Firing Range In Assam
desc: An Army soldier was killed in a blast at Assam's Darrang field firing range. The explosion happened when he was on sentry duty at the range on Monday, the Army said.

title: Marine Commandos, Army To Be Deployed For G20 Meeting In Srinagar
desc: Marine commandos, National Security Guards (NSGs) and the Army are among security forces deployed for the upcoming G20 working group meeting in Srinagar.

title: Youth Congress Chief Skips Assam Police Summons In Harassment Case
desc: Indian Youth Congress chief Srinivas BV has filed an anticipatory bail request before the Gauhati High Court in a case of alleged harassment and gender discrimination filed by an expelled party leader.

title: "Their Internal Matter": Congress On Sharad Pawar's Surprise Resignation
desc: The Congress on Tuesday said NCP leader Sharad Pawar's decision to step down as the party chief is an internal matter and it would not be proper for it to interfere in it.

title: "Biased, Motivated": India On US Government's Religious Freedom Report
desc: India on Tuesday categorically trashed as "biased" and "motivated" a report by the US Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) that alleged "severe violations" of religious freedom in the country.

title: "Assisting In Every Possible Manner": Aviation Minister On Go First Crisis
desc: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Tuesday said it was unfortunate that the operational bottleneck related to engine supplies has dealt a blow to the airline's financial position.

title: Indian Embassy Temporarily Shifts From Khartoum To Port Sudan
desc: The Indian embassy in Sudan has been temporarily shifted to Port Sudan as fighting intensified in Khartoum city, where it was located.

title: India, France Carry Out Joint 'Exercise Orion' Drills With Rafale Jets
desc: Rafale jets of India and France have been jointly carrying out aerial drills as part of a multinational air exercise at the French airbase of Mont-de-Marsan, officials said on Tuesday.
